title: User Interface Patterns and Accessibility
summary: Guidance for SvelteKit UI components, state management, controls, and WCAG accessibility requirements.
description: Define component patterns, theming, keyboard navigation, and automations for the operator workflows (tuning, feeds, audit). Ensure WCAG AAA where feasible and include automated accessibility tests.
interactions: UI uses session cookies to fetch user info and permissions upon load.
Forms call API endpoints and show inline validation/errors.
Audit views allow filtering, pagination, and export of audit entries.
accessibility: All interactive controls must be keyboard operable.
Color contrast must meet WCAG AA minimum (AAA where practical).
Provide ARIA attributes for complex widgets.
tech_stack: TailwindCSS for utility styles (project has CSS files)
acceptance_criteria: Key pages reachable and operable via keyboard and screen reader.
Forms validate equivalently server and client side.
E2E tests cover major workflows (homepage, login, triggers endpoints).
tasks: Review `src/lib/controls/panel.svelte` and document patterns to reuse.
Add basic axe-core accessibility checks in the e2e pipeline.
Document design tokens (colors, spacing) and ensure consistent usage.
